storyTitle: As QA Tester, I want to perform validation testing to ensure input validation behaves as expected

functional.title: Verify client-side real-time validation displays error messages for required fields
preconditions: Test environment is accessible and functional
User is logged in with QA Tester role permissions
Test form with validation rules is loaded in browser
Browser console is open to monitor client-side validation events
Test data set with valid and invalid inputs is prepared

steps.action: Navigate to the test form page containing input fields with validation rules
steps.expectedResult: Form page loads successfully with all input fields visible and empty

steps.action: Click into the 'Email Address' required field and then click outside without entering any data
steps.expectedResult: Red error message 'Email Address is required' appears immediately below the field with error icon

steps.action: Enter valid email 'testuser@example.com' in the 'Email Address' field
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears, field border changes to green, and success checkmark icon appears

steps.action: Click into 'Phone Number' required field, enter '555-1234', then delete all characters
steps.expectedResult: Red error message 'Phone Number is required' displays immediately with error icon

steps.action: Verify error message styling includes red text color (#D32F2F), error icon, and appropriate ARIA attributes
steps.expectedResult: Error message has correct styling, aria-live='polite' attribute, and role='alert' for screen reader compatibility

postconditions: Form remains in editable state with validation active
All validation error messages are cleared when valid data is entered
Browser console shows no JavaScript errors related to validation
Form data is not submitted to server until all validations pass

functional.title: Verify server-side validation rejects invalid data with appropriate HTTP error responses
preconditions: Test API endpoint is accessible and responding
User has valid authentication token for API requests
API testing tool (Postman/Insomnia) is configured with test environment
Test database is in known state with existing test records
Network monitoring tool is active to capture request/response

steps.action: Send POST request to '/api/users' endpoint with payload containing invalid email format: {"email": "invalidemail", "name": "Test User"}
steps.expectedResult: Server returns HTTP 400 Bad Request with JSON response: {"error": "Invalid email format", "field": "email"}

steps.action: Send POST request with missing required field: {"email": "test@example.com"} without 'name' field
steps.expectedResult: Server returns HTTP 400 Bad Request with JSON response: {"error": "Name is required", "field": "name"}

steps.action: Send POST request with valid data: {"email": "valid@example.com", "name": "Valid User"}
steps.expectedResult: Server returns HTTP 201 Created with JSON response containing created user object and unique ID

steps.action: Verify database to confirm invalid data from steps 1-2 was NOT persisted
steps.expectedResult: Database query shows no records created for invalid requests, only valid request from step 3 is saved

steps.action: Check server logs for validation error entries with timestamps and request details
steps.expectedResult: Server logs contain validation error entries with severity level 'WARNING', timestamp, and rejected payload details

postconditions: Database contains only valid data from successful requests
Invalid data attempts are logged in server error logs
API returns consistent error response format across all validation failures
No data corruption or partial saves occurred from invalid requests

functional.title: Verify validation error messages are accurate, clear, and user-friendly across all form fields
preconditions: Test form with multiple field types (text, email, number, date, dropdown) is loaded
User is logged in and has access to the form
Error message content specification document is available for reference
Browser is set to default language (English) for testing

steps.action: Leave 'Username' required field empty and attempt to submit form by clicking 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Username is required' appears in red text below the field with clear, non-technical language

steps.action: Enter 'ab' in 'Username' field that requires minimum 3 characters
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Username must be at least 3 characters long' displays with current character count indicator

steps.action: Enter 'test@invalid' in 'Email' field and move focus to next field
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Please enter a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com)' appears with example format

steps.action: Enter '-50' in 'Age' field that requires positive numbers only
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Age must be a positive number' displays immediately upon input

steps.action: Select future date in 'Birth Date' field that should be in the past
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Birth Date cannot be in the future' appears with calendar icon and clear instruction

steps.action: Verify all error messages use consistent formatting, color scheme, and positioning across different field types
steps.expectedResult: All error messages use same red color (#D32F2F), appear below respective fields, use same font size (14px), and include error icon

postconditions: All error messages match approved content specification
Error messages provide actionable guidance for users to correct inputs
No technical jargon or system error codes are exposed to users
Form remains in editable state allowing users to correct errors

Performance metrics are documented and compared against baseline

negative.title: Verify validation handles SQL injection attempts in text input fields

Security testing is approved and documented in test plan

steps.expectedResult: Client-side validation rejects input with error message 'Username contains invalid characters', form does not submit

steps.action: Bypass client-side validation using browser console and send POST request with SQL injection payload directly to server
steps.expectedResult: Server returns HTTP 400 Bad Request with error message 'Invalid input detected', payload is sanitized and not executed

steps.action: Verify database tables remain intact by querying 'users' table
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns expected results, 'users' table exists with all records intact, no data loss occurred

steps.action: Check server security logs for SQL injection attempt detection and logging
steps.expectedResult: Security log contains entry with severity 'CRITICAL', timestamp, source IP, and blocked SQL injection payload details

steps.action: Test additional SQL injection patterns: "1' OR '1'='1", "admin'--", "'; SELECT * FROM users WHERE ''='"
steps.expectedResult: All SQL injection attempts are blocked by server-side validation, appropriate error messages returned, no database queries executed

postconditions: Database integrity is maintained with no unauthorized modifications
All SQL injection attempts are logged in security audit trail
Application remains functional and secure after attack attempts
Security incident report is generated for review

postconditions: No XSS vulnerabilities are exploitable in validation inputs

reliability.title: Validation Service Resilience Under Database Connection Failure
reliability.description: Validate that input validation system maintains client-side functionality and provides graceful degradation when database connection fails during server-side validation operations. Test circuit breaker activation and fallback mechanisms.
preconditions: Validation service is operational with both client-side and server-side validation enabled
Database connection monitoring is configured
Circuit breaker pattern is implemented for database calls
Baseline validation response time established (< 200ms)

steps.action: Establish steady state by submitting 100 valid and invalid form inputs, measuring success rate and response times
steps.expectedResult: 100% validation success rate, average response time < 200ms, all error messages display correctly

steps.action: Inject database connection failure using chaos engineering tool (e.g., Gremlin, Chaos Monkey) - terminate database connections
steps.expectedResult: Database connection pool reports failure, circuit breaker opens within 5 seconds

steps.action: Submit form inputs with various validation scenarios (required fields, format validation, length constraints)
steps.expectedResult: Client-side validation continues to function normally, server-side validation returns graceful error message 'Validation service temporarily unavailable, please try again', no 500 errors exposed to user

steps.action: Monitor system behavior for 2 minutes during failure state, attempt 50 form submissions
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker remains open, client-side validation blocks obviously invalid inputs, user receives consistent error messaging, no data loss occurs

steps.action: Restore database connection and monitor recovery
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker transitions to half-open state within 30 seconds, successful validation request closes circuit breaker, full functionality restored within 60 seconds (MTTR < 60s)

steps.action: Verify data integrity by checking all submissions during failure period
steps.expectedResult: No corrupted validation records, all failed submissions properly logged for retry, transaction rollback successful for incomplete operations

postconditions: System returns to steady state with 100% validation functionality
Circuit breaker is in closed state
No data corruption or orphaned records exist
All monitoring alerts are cleared
reliability.testData: Test dataset: 50 valid forms (proper email format, required fields filled, valid phone numbers), 50 invalid forms (missing required fields, malformed emails, SQL injection attempts, XSS payloads)

reliability.title: External Validation Service Dependency Failure and Fallback Testing

preconditions: External validation services integrated (email verification, address validation)

steps.action: Restore external services and monitor circuit breaker recovery and cache refresh
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker transitions to half-open after 60 seconds, successful test request closes circuit, previously unverified validations queued for re-verification, full service restored within 90 seconds (MTTR < 90s)

postconditions: External services operational and circuit breaker closed

Unverified entries re-processed and updated
System metrics return to baseline

reliability.title: Circuit Breaker State Transitions and Retry Policy Validation Under Load
reliability.description: Validate circuit breaker state transitions (closed ‚Üí open ‚Üí half-open ‚Üí closed) and exponential backoff retry policy under sustained load conditions. Ensure validation service protects itself from cascading failures while maximizing availability.
preconditions: Circuit breaker configured: failure threshold 50%, minimum 10 requests, timeout 30 seconds
Retry policy configured: max 3 retries, exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s)
Load testing environment prepared with 500 concurrent users
Monitoring dashboards configured for circuit breaker metrics

steps.action: Generate baseline load: 500 concurrent users submitting validation requests at 10 requests/second for 2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker in closed state, 99% success rate, average response time 200ms, zero circuit breaker trips

steps.action: Introduce intermittent failures in validation service (50% failure rate) while maintaining load
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker detects failure threshold exceeded (50% of 10+ requests failing), transitions to open state within 5 seconds, fast-fail responses returned immediately without calling failing service

steps.action: Monitor system behavior in open state for 30 seconds under continued load
steps.expectedResult: All requests fail fast with circuit open error, response time < 10ms (no backend calls), retry logic NOT activated for circuit-open failures, system protected from overload

steps.action: Wait for circuit breaker timeout (30 seconds), observe transition to half-open state
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker automatically transitions to half-open state after 30 seconds, allows single test request through to validation service

steps.action: With circuit in half-open state and failures still occurring, submit test requests
steps.expectedResult: If test request fails, circuit immediately reopens for another 30 seconds, retry logic activates with exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s) for transient errors, max 3 retry attempts before final failure

steps.action: Restore validation service to healthy state, wait for next half-open transition and successful test request
steps.expectedResult: Successful test request in half-open state closes circuit breaker, full traffic resumes, success rate returns to 99%, MTTR from failure injection to full recovery < 120 seconds

steps.action: Verify retry policy behavior: introduce single transient failure (timeout) during normal operation
steps.expectedResult: Request retried with 1s delay (first retry), if fails again 2s delay (second retry), if fails third time 4s delay (final retry), total max time 7 seconds before final failure, exponential backoff confirmed

postconditions: Circuit breaker in closed state with healthy service
All retry queues cleared
Load testing stopped and resources released
Circuit breaker metrics logged for analysis

userStoryObject.title: As QA Tester, I want to perform validation testing to ensure input validation behaves as expected
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:

Validation features must be thoroughly tested to prevent data quality issues and user dissatisfaction.

CURRENT STATE:

Limited test coverage on validation features causes potential undetected defects.

DESIRED STATE:

Comprehensive test coverage ensures robust validation and consistent user feedback.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:

  • Test client-side real-time validation
  • Test server-side validation and error handling
  • Verify error message accuracy and clarity
  • Test performance under load
  • Validate accessibility of feedback elements


USER INTERACTION FLOW:

  1. Execute test cases on validation features
  2. Identify defects or inconsistencies
  3. Report and verify fixes
  4. Confirm validation meets requirements


TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:

  • Test tools: Automation frameworks, load testing tools
  • Data source: Test input forms
  • Validation: Confirm acceptance criteria


OUT OF SCOPE:

  • Development of validation logic


SUCCESS METRICS:

  • 100% test case coverage for validation functionality
  • Zero critical defects in validation features post-release
  • Test execution completed within scheduled timeframe

Persona: QA Tester (QA Tester)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: All defined validation test cases execute successfully with expected results

Criteria 2: Client-side validation error messages display correctly for invalid inputs

Criteria 3: Server-side validation rejects invalid data with appropriate error responses

Criteria 4: Validation features perform correctly under simulated high load

Criteria 5: Accessibility compliance of validation feedback verified through testing
